contentrichtext.text: '''Earl of Woolton''' is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1956 for the businessman and [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] politician [[Frederick Marquis, 1st Earl of Woolton|Frederick Marquis, 1st Viscount Woolton]]. He had already been created '''Baron Woolton''' of Liverpool in the County of Lancaster in 1939, '''Viscount Woolton''' of Liverpool in the County of Lancaster in 1953 and was made '''Viscount Walberton''' of Walberton in the County of Sussex at the same time as he was given the earldom. These title are also in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. As of 2011 the titles are held by his grandson, the third Earl, who succeeded his father in 1969. The family seat is Auchnacree House, near [[Forfar]], [[Angus]]. ==Earls of Woolton (1956)== *[[Frederick Marquis, 1st Earl of Woolton|Frederick James Marquis, 1st Earl of Woolton]] (1883–1964) *[[Roger Marquis, 2nd Earl of Woolton|Roger David Marquis, 2nd Earl of Woolton]] (1922–1969) *[[Simon Marquis, 3rd Earl of Woolton|Simon Frederick Marquis, 3rd Earl of Woolton]] (b. 1958) There is no heir to the titles. ==References== *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Woolton}} [[Category:Earldoms in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
